If the initial conditions \\( x_0 \\) and \\( y_0 \\) of \\( z(t) \\) are set at t = 0 and the system is allowed to evolve over time without any external intervention, will the relationship between initial conditions and \\( z(T) \\) for some T > 0 be explicitly traceable?
Explanation: The development of \\( z(t) \\) is directly traceable from the exponential growth terms modulated by A and B. Since there are no additional transformations or external factors introduced after t = 0, \\( z(T) \\) can be accurately calculated and traced back to \\( x_0 \\) and \\( y_0 \\) using the given relations.
